intro: Panicum muehlenbergii, commonly known as eastern gamagrass, is a tall, perennial grass native to the eastern United States. It typically grows to heights of 2 to 5 feet and is characterized by its wide, flat leaves and feathery, pinkish-tan seed heads. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist to wet soils in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife. Its ornamental value also makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
